New Records: Suryakumar Yadav cracked a 28-ball 53 to set India up for a convincing 47-run win over Afghanistan in their opening Super Eights match at the T20 World Cup.
Jasprit Bumrah claimed three for seven
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit five fours and three sixes
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and will bat
India made a sluggish start with Rashid Khan instrumental as they slipped to 90 for four
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav is the player of the match for his eye-popping fifty
Bumrah must have run him close with three for seven
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Super Eights come thick and fast – tomorrow Australia take on Bangladesh in the early game, and England return to the Daren Sammy Stadium to battle South Africa at 3.30BST
India’s Jasprit Bumrah, left, celebrates the dismissal of Afghanistan’s Najibullah Zadran
India's Suryakumar Yadav (right) heads down the wicket for a run during his 28-ball 53
Others: The match was played at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
India posted 181 for eight at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
Afghanistan’s reply never recovered from the loss of three wickets inside the first five overs
